                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
On January 28, 1985, as famine devastated the African continent, a stellar 
roster of musical talent entered a recording studio in Los Angeles, CA, to make 
a record dedicated to alleviating hunger in the Third World. The song was called 
{&"We Are the World,"} the collected artists billed themselves as "USA for 
Africa," and the single became a phenomenon, raising over $60 million for 
African famine relief. We Are the World: The Story Behind the Song is a 
documentary which examines how the song was written, how producer Quincy Jones 
and songwriters Michael Jackson and Lionel Richie persuaded some of the most 
popular performers in America to donate their services to the project, and 
offers a behind-the-scenes look at the marathon recording session that produced 
the single. Performers include Ray Charles, Bruce Springsteen, Tina Turner, Bob 
Dylan, Stevie Wonder, Billy Joel, Willie Nelson, Paul Simon, Bette Midler, Diana 
Ross, and many more. ~ Mark Deming, Rovi
